wrm.exmo.transform

Class FluentMapper<S,T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrm.exmo.transform.RuleBuilderBase
      • wrm.exmo.transform.FluentMapper<S,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - source type
    T - target type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    TypeConverter<S,T>, IScriptSupportAware
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    XmlFluentMapper

    public abstract class FluentMapper<S,T>
extends RuleBuilderBase
implements TypeConverter<S,T>, IScriptSupportAware
    This is the baseclass of a declarative mapping framework with a fluent mapping API. Extending this class allows the definition of Bean-to-Bean mappers. The framework is rule-based, rules are defined using the fluent DSL. Schematic syntax: map(Selector).to("targetProperty")[.with(Converter)*][.andDo(Callback)][.onNull(Selector)][.elementsOfType(Class)] A selector returns a value, if a object is fed in. (aka selects a value) A converter converts this value, that is, from type a to type b or just value transformation Every FluentMapper is a Converter, so you can define a new fluent mapper here to have "sub"-mappers There can be multiple converters. A Callback is called after (successful) mapping onNull states, that the value of this selector will be used if the original one returns null. elementsOfType(Class) will map list onto lists and calls the supplied converters on each element instead of on the list Several utility methods provide easy creation of Selectors, Converters and Callbacks. See RuleBuilderBase for more infos.
    Author:
    pemucha
